Copying 5.3/6.0 Folders to Other 5.3/6.0 Project Roots

Copying folders to other 5.3/6.0 project roots enables you to share data between 5.3/6.0 project roots. When you copy a folder to another 5.3/6.0 project root, you must select a project as the destination. Refer to the copy matrix for more information.

Note: You cannot copy a folder to the top level of a project root or to another folder.

The following information applies to folders that are shared between 5.3/6.0 project roots:

  • The copied folder retains the original workfile location.
  • The copied folder retains the original archive location.
  • Only the contents of the folder at the moment you copy it are shared. If you update the original folder by adding workfiles to it, the copied folder is not updated automatically, although you can copy new files into it at any time.
  • To work with the copied folder in the 5.3/6.0 desktop client, you must modify the project configuration settings to include the appropriate workfile and archive locations.
  • To update the contents of the copied folder using the 5.3/6.0 desktop client, select Folder | Change Folder Members and add the appropriate files from the original archive location to the shared folder.

To copy a folder to a different project root:

  1. In the Project pane, select the folder you want to copy.

  2. Select Edit | Copy. The Copy Folder dialog box appears.

  3. Select a project in a different 5.3/6.0 project root.

  4. Click Next. Version Manager copies the folder and its contents to the selected destination.
